titleInfo.title: Letter No. 305 of 1852 from Arthur Malet, Chief Secretary to the Government, Secret Department, Bombay to Captain Arnold Burrowes Kemball, Resident in the Persian Gulf

mods.abstract: The letter is forwarding a couple of communications, so that the Resident may be informed of the wishes of the British Government. The item has two enclosures:1. Letter from James Howard Harris, Foreign Secretary, to the President of the Board of Commissioners for the Affairs of India, dated 7 July 1852.The enclosure suggests that in light of a suggestion made for the stationing of a ship of war in the Persian Gulf for the purpose of preventing the slave trade, that the commander in question is also employed to report on the new fortifications being built on the Persian Coast.2. Letter from the Chief Secretary to the Bombay Government to Henry John Leeke, Commodore and Commander-in-Chief of the Indian Navy, dated 11 September 1852.The enclosure is soliciting any remarks the Commodore may have concerning the content of enclosure No. 1.
